snippet: New York State’s chief judge unveiled a groundbreaking rule that will require law students to perform 50 hours of pro bono legal work.
abstract: Editorial urges other jurisdictions to follow new New York State plan for requiring law students to perform 50 hours of pro bono legal services as a condition of admission to state bar; notes severe shortage of legal help for low-income people.
lead_paragraph: New York State’s chief judge unveiled a groundbreaking rule that will require law students to perform 50 hours of pro bono legal work.
